paragraphs.text: Solution: Providing users with an easy way to check and select their shipping address on the product page would allow them to skip a step in the checkout flow and speed up the checkout process.
paragraphs.name: 4ae6

718847b05599.title: What happens if the user doesn’t pick an address? Isn't this a mandatory step?

paragraphs.text: What happens if the user doesn’t pick an address? Isn't this a mandatory step?
paragraphs.name: a5ca

paragraphs.text: A possible solution could be to prefill default shipping address or don't show shipping step here at all and have an open shipping address form during checkout.

74751b38ade2.title: I can appretiate all of the work put into this case study although this reminds me of a UX version…

paragraphs.text:
I can appretiate all of the work put into this case study although this reminds me of a UX version of a Redesign of say Google or Twitter.
There’s probably a ton of context that’s missing behind the decisions made for the app which needs to be understood & appretiated before claiming improvements.
paragraphs.name: b4c9
